sub_title: Senior Project Officer Protection of Civilians (PoC) at PAX for peace
summary: Conflict Studies & Human Rights graduate with a strong interest in conflict analysis and resolution, and a passion for research. Currently employed as Project Officer at PAX's Protection of Civilians team where I work on research and advocacy related to civilian harm mitigation and response.
treasury_media: [{'url': 'https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/13537113.2021.2003624', 'title': 'Securitization of Muslims in Myanmar’s Early Transition (2010–15), in the Journal of Nationalism and Ethnic Politics (co-authored)', 'description': 'Published in the Journal of Nationalism and Ethnic Politics, this article analyses the emergence of an anti-Muslim movement in Myanmar. Between 2010-15, as Myanmar transitioned from authoritarian rule to a more liberal and democratic state, its Muslim population increasingly faced hate speech and violence. The authors approach the notion of a “Muslim threat” to Myanmar’s Buddhist population as the outcome of a dynamic process of securitization by an alliance of political and religious elites.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4D27AQFuP4jjei1uxw/articleshare-shrink_800/0/1691817483563?e=1692946800&v=beta&t=3vwH735kGXlQRtIoSc0BBc6SuzLHcD7Hes1Tijl1EDc'}, {'url': 'https://protectionofcivilians.org/hawija-research/', 'title': 'Co-lead of Hawija research project', 'description': "Over the course of 2021-22, PAX, Utrecht University and Al-Ghad League conducted extensive research into the 2015 OIR airstrike on Hawija (Iraq) and its resulting civilian harm. The project combined field research, interviews with 119 affected civilians, 40 Key Informant Interviews, and documentary analysis to provide an in-depth account of the operation's short and long-term implications for civilians. Output: a detailed investigative report and two launch events (in Erbil and Amsterdam).", 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4E27AQE3pN0LbrQcPw/articleshare-shrink_1280_800/0/1691136163650?e=1692946800&v=beta&t=rBrLe6tt2708GKviS1O6HjTerTJSayNpbz31u2NfoFg'}, {'url': None, 'title': "Co-editor and author of 'On Civilian Harm'", 'description': "The PAX book publication 'On Civilian Harm' researches the varied manifestations of 'civilian harm' as a result of the use of violence. It advocates an understanding of the topic that extends beyond civilian casualties (injuries and death), to also encompass psychological trauma, adverse socio-economic effects, and harm resulting from damage to infrastructure.", 'image': None}]
